subject: Relationships
subcategory: Famous Love Stories That Changed History
title: Robert and Elizabeth Barrett Browning
description: Learn Robert and Elizabeth Barrett Browning in one minute.

hook.text: She was an invalid, trapped by a controlling father. He wrote her a letter. They eloped. She wrote the greatest sonnets.

buildup.text: Elizabeth Barrett was already a famous poet when Robert Browning wrote to her in 1845. A correspondence blossomed.

discovery.text: Her father forbade all his children from marrying. Elizabeth defied him, secretly marrying Robert and fleeing to Italy.

twist.text: In Italy, Elizabeth's health improved dramatically. Love and freedom healed what medicine could not.

climax.text: 'How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.' Her Sonnets from the Portuguese are love poetry's highest peak.

punchline.text: Elizabeth defied her father, eloped, and wrote poetry's greatest love sonnets.

quiz.question: Why did Elizabeth Barrett Browning elope?
options: Her father forbade all his children from marrying
